section.body: Beep Boop, I am a tin can with no feelings.

section.header: I would be freaking out, but this new body doesn't have an emotional subroutine. Should I install one?
section.body: I wouldn't recommend it. You're best without those pesky distractions. Don't mind your "friends" telling you that you're different now. You don't need them.

section.header: Why is my long-time friend a robot?
Question: I died right before I got into the Medium, and got a robot body. Now I don't have emotions?
section.body: If you were like me, you felt that way before being a robot. Just pretend so that people you care about stop telling you that they miss you being alive. They need to realize that you're still cool.

section.header: I went to the Alchemy station, and then I woke up and I was a robot?
section.body:
Ah, classic teleportaton problem. Your fleshy self must have decided to captchalog themselves some how (brain in a jar is a popular method) and then combine themself into a robot. Since you have all the memories of your original self, you get to experience the weirdness of having all their memories up until you split.
I advise you focus on how much you've gained rather than worry about what you've lost.

section.header: Holy shit I am full of FEELINGS. I thought tin cans were supposed to not have any emotions.
Quick question: this sentence is false.
section.body: 1: Fuck you. 2: That's not a question. 3: Fuck you.
